note: Foucault, 2005a: 185). See also Foucault’s (1994: 277–81) review of Glucksmann’s The Master Thinkers. Christofferson (2004: especially 198–201) offers a useful discussion of the relationship between Foucault and the nouveaux philosophes; see also Dews (1979).
title: An interview from 1978, for example, sees Foucault stating: ‘Out of the visions of Marx, the visions of socialists, from their thoughts and their analyses, which were among the most objective, rational, and seemingly accurate thoughts and analyses, emerged in actuality political systems, social organizations, and economic mechanisms that today are condemned and ought to be discarded
The term ‘deterritorialization’ is adapted from Lacan: see Holland (1999: 19–20) for a brief but useful elucidation; also Holland
